data.answer: σ value of 2.3 × 10−3 S cm−1 at 91.5% RH

data.question: What is the Curie temperature (Tc) of the compound?
How does the compound achieve high proton conductivity?
data.answer: Through a Grotthus mechanism facilitated by humidity.

data.question: Is the compound ferromagnetic at room temperature?

Can the compound's proton conductivity be measured using a two-probe method?
What is the role of ammonium cations in the compound?
data.answer: They compensate for the four negative charges of the repeating unit of the bimetallic coordination network.

data.question: How was the compound synthesized?
data.answer: By slow diffusion of ethanol in an aqueous solution containing stoichiometric amounts of MnCl2·4H2O and (NH4)3[Cr(ox)3]·3H2O.
